docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Welcome to our documentation that will help you navigate to three important sections in the myBCIT website. The goal is provide a detailed tutorial that streamlines BCIT students in finding their course schedule, creating an e-mail signature, and forwarding myBCIT e-mails to their personal e-mail address.

docs.title: Intended User
docs.text:
This documentation is targeted towards the following user:

  • New and current BCIT students with a myBCIT account who are looking for their course schedule and help with optimizing their myBCIT e-mail.

docs.title: Prerequisite Knowledge:
docs.text:
This documentation assumes:

  • Working knowledge on navigating a website
  • Ability to search for information in an e-mail platform

docs.title: Software Requirements
docs.text:
Please ensure that you have one of the following internet browers installed:

  • Google Chrome v122.0 or later
  • Safari v17.3.1 or later
  • Firefox v124 or later
  • Microsoft Edge v131 or later
  • Any other updated internet browsers

docs.title: Procedures Overview
docs.text:
The main sections of this documentation are summarized below:

  • Accessing BCIT Course Schedule
  • Creating E-mail Signature
  • Forwarding BCIT E-mail

docs.title: Typographical Conventions
docs.text:
1. Instructions that require you to click on an item, such as a link or a button, or press a keyboard key, will be bolded. For example:
    • Click on the "Continue" button
    • Press the Enter key
  2. Instructions that require you to type in information will be underlined. For example:
    • Enter your information

docs.title: Notes, Danger, and Success Messages
docs.text:
Throughout the documentation, you'll encounter message blocks that alert you with relevant information.

Danger

Specific actions may cause issues when navigating the website.

Note

Provides additional information regarding a specific task.

Success

Indicates what a successful task looks like.

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text: That's it! Begin learning how to access your BCIT course schedule. Accessing BCIT Course Schedule

docs.title: Glossary
docs.text: Term Description E-mail Signature Your name or message that appears at the end of every email E-mail Forwarding Sending your emails to another email address automatically Filter Organizing your email to show only certain categories based on rules Dropdown A menu that shows options when clicked, like choosing settings Textbox A box where you can type or edit information, like your signature Filter Automating specific actions based on actions chosen in the settings Filter Set A group where you can add multiple filters inside of it myBCIT BCIT webpage for students to access information regarding for staff and students

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: In this section, we will focus on helping you access your course schedule using myBCIT website. This website will serve as your main way of accessing your school related information. By the end of this section you will know how to access your BCIT course schedule using the myBCIT Website.

docs.title: Steps to Login to myBCIT Website
docs.text:
Before accessing your BCIT course schedule, you will need to login to the myBCIT website.

  1. Ensure you have a BCIT Account Example:

    • E-mail: Looney@my.bcit.ca
    • Password: 1234562

  2. Type in the search bar: https://my.bcit.ca/ and press the Enter key. You will be directed to myBCIT Login Page

    Note

    BCIT recommends using Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, or Mozilla Firefox as the web browser

  3. Type in your BCIT account credentials

  4. Click the "SIGN IN" button

    Note

    You will now be directed to the myBCIT home page with your student name shown in the upper right of the screen

docs.title: Navigate to Course Schedule
docs.text:
1. Find the “Online Self Service” category on the right side of the myBCIT website

  2. In the “Student Self Service” header, click on “Check Course Schedules”

  3. Read “Course Schedule Information”

  4. Click on the “I have read the information above” checkbox to show a checkmark

  5. Click on the "Continue" Button

Success

Great job! You have access to your course schedule. You will find your course name and number, room number, and course times

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text:
By the end of this section, you will have learned the following:

  • ⭐  How to navigate through the myBCIT webpage
  • ⭐  How to access and view your course schedule

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text: Excellent work! Feel free to proceed to the next step. Changing BCIT E-mail Signature

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
In this section, you'll learn how to create a BCIT e-mail signature, which will be automatically inserted at the bottom of every e-mail you send. Creating an e-mail signature serves several purposes1:

  • Increases Professionalism
  • Shows Personality
  • Creates Personal Branding

These are only a few benefits that an e-mail signature can provide. Whether you're a student or preparing for a job hunt, an e-mail signature can be tailored accordingly!

By the end of this section, e-mails you send using your BCIT e-mail will contain a customized e-mail signature.

docs.title: Steps to Login to myBCIT Website
docs.text:
Before creating your e-mail signature, you will need to login to the myBCIT website:

  1. Ensure you have a BCIT Account Example:

    • E-mail: Looney@my.bcit.ca
    • Password: 1234562

  2. Type in the search bar: https://my.bcit.ca/ and press the Enter key. You will be directed to myBCIT Login Page

  3. Type in your Account Credentials

  4. Click the "SIGN IN" button

    Note

    You will now be directed to the myBCIT Home Tab with your student name shown in the upper right of the screen

    Danger

    Repeatedly signing in with wrong credentials can cause the BCIT Website to block you devices from logging in

docs.title: Navigate to BCIT Mail
docs.text:
1. Click "My Mail” which is seen on the left of your student name

    Note

    You will be directed to your BCIT Mail Webpage to your mail inbox

docs.title: Create E-mail Signature
docs.text:
1. Click “Settings”, found on the upper right of the website

    Note

    You will now be directed to the “Settings” page

  2. Click “Identities” under the 'Settings' header

  3. Click your Name found under the 'Identities' header

    Note

    It will open an 'Edit Identity' page on the right side of your webpage

  4. Click on the Textbox beside 'Signature' to start editing it

    Note

    You can edit your e-mail signature anyway you'd like and feel free to refer to our sample signature

  5. Click the blue button “Save”, after you finish editing to save.

docs.title: Verifying Signature
docs.text:
Test to ensure the signature is seen when you send a e-mail

  1. Click “Mail” found on the upper right of the website, to go back to your BCIT mail inbox

  2. Click “Compose” found on the upper left of the website

    Note

    You will now be directed to a page where you will be composing an e-mail

  3. Verify that your signature block is populated in the e-mail message

Success

Well done! You have now created a signature for your BCIT e-mail

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text:
By the end of this section, you will have learned the following:

  • ⭐  How to create your e-mail signature for your BCIT E-mail
  • ⭐  How to access your BCIT E-mail from myBCIT website

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Wonderful job! Feel free to proceed to the next step.

Forwarding BCIT E-mail

1. The positive benefits of a personal email signature

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
In this section, we will walk you through how to enable e-mail forwarding from your BCIT e-mail to a more frequently used e-mail. By enabling this feature, you'll enjoy quicker access to your BCIT e-mails and minimizes the risk of missing important e-mails. Additional benefits include1 :

  • Enhanced Productivity
  • Centralized Mailbox

By the end of this section, you'll be comfortable setting up a forwarding system from your BCIT e-mail to your desired e-mail address(es).

docs.title: Steps to Login to myBCIT Website
docs.text:
Before forwarding your e-mail, you will need to login to the myBCIT website:

  1. Ensure you have a BCIT Account Example:

    • E-mail: Looney@my.bcit.ca
    • Password: 1234562

  2. Type in the search bar: https://my.bcit.ca/ and press the Enter key. You will be directed to myBCIT Login Page

  3. Type in your Account Credentials

  4. Click the "SIGN IN" button

    Note

    You will now be directed to the myBCIT Home Tab with your student name shown in the upper right of the screen

    Danger

    Repeatedly signing in with wrong credentials can cause the BCIT Website to block your devices from logging in

docs.title: Navigate to BCIT Mail
docs.text:
1. Click on “My Mail” at the top-right corner

    Note

    You will be directed to your BCIT Mail Inbox Page in a new tab

docs.title: Creating a Filter Set
docs.text:
1. Click “Settings”, found on the upper right of the website

  2. Click on “Filter”, found on the left side of the page

  3. Click on + found under the filters set section

    Note

    This will open the new filters set in the right side

  4. Type "Forwarding" for Filters Set Name and select and click none for filters

    Note

    • This will create a filter set named Forwarding under filter sets
    • which allows you to group the different filters you want for your e-mails

  5. Find and click the newly created filter set name "Forwarding" under the "Filter Sets"

docs.title: Enabling Email Forwarding
docs.text:
1. Click on the + under "filters"

    Note

    This will open "Filter Definition" section

  2. Type "Forwarding to Gmail" for Filter name and Select "all messages"

  3. Click on the drop-down menu and select “Redirect message to”

  4. Type the e-mail address that you want to forward your incoming BCIT Emails to

  5. Click on the “Save” button

    Success

    • The newly created filter profile will appear under filters
    • Now, all e-mails sent to your myBCIT e-mail address will automatically be forwarded to the e-mail address(es) you specified

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text:
By the end of this section, you will have learned the following:

  • ⭐  How to forward e-mails from your BCIT inbox to a different e-mail address
  • ⭐  How to create filter sets and join different filters together
